revision.text:
'''Choti Lamsam''' ({{lang-th|โชติ ล่ำซำ}}; {{RTGS|''Chot Lamsam''}}) was a Thai businessman who founded the [[Kasikornbank]] or otherwise known as the Thai Farmers Bank in 1945 with registered capital of [[Thai baht|Baht]] 5 Million. The bank has been listed on the [[Stock Exchange of Thailand]] (SET) since 1976.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://info.gotomanager.com/news/details.aspx?id=9363|script-title=th:ตระกูลล่ำซำ "คนใส่เสื้อสีฟ้า"|date=March 1986|magazine=Manager|language=Thai|accessdate=2 November 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kasikornbank.com/TH/WhatHot/Pages/Restructuring.aspx|script-title=th:ธนาคารกสิกรไทย ปรับโครงสร้างการบริหาร|date=28 February 2013|language=Thai|accessdate=2 November 2014}}</ref>
Choti was born in 1879 to a [[Hakka]] family. His father, Ng Yuk Long, was a 2nd generation Chinese in Thailand (from Guangdong province). After Ng Meow Ngian, Yuk Long's father died, Yuk Long took over his father timber business, expanded and exported to Europe and Asia. He also owned agricultural trading, saw mills and rice mills. After 1932, he also set up Insurance and banking business. In 1939, Yuk Long was murdered by Chinese mafia. Choti and his brothers, Julin and Kasem, took over the family business. During World War II banking business started to blossom, Choti established Thai Farmer Bank on June 8, 1945, focusing on retail banking and customers in the rural areas. Choti died in 1948 (2491 BE).<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.thaiseoboard.com/index.php?topic=46257.0;wap2|title=เส้นทางชีวิตของผู้เริ่มต้นจาก 0 > ตระกูลล่ำซำ|website=www.thaiseoboard.com|access-date=2016-03-14}}</ref>
Choti Lamsam's grandson, Banthoon, is ranked as the 21st richest in Thailand, Forbes, 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/banthoon-lamsam/|title=Thailand's 50 Richest: Banthoon Lamsam & family}}</ref>
==See also== *[[Lamsam family]]
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Lamsam, Choti}} [[Category:Thai bankers]] [[Category:Thai people of Chinese descent]] [[Category:Thai businesspeople]] [[Category:Thai people of Hakka descent]] [[Category:People from Meixian District]] [[Category:1904 births]] [[Category:1948 deaths]] [[Category:Lamsam family]]
{{thailand-bio-stub}}

__NOTOC__ {{Use mdy dates|date=May 2013}} {{coord|40.7157|-74.0073|dim:1000_region:US-NY|display=title}} {{multiple image | align = right | direction = horizontal | image1 = PO 90 Church St jeh.JPG | width1 = 203 | caption1 = Church Street Station post office | image2 = 33 thomas st.jpg | width2 = 160 | caption2 = AT&T Long Lines Building }} '''Church Street''' is a short, but heavily travelled, north-south street in [[Lower Manhattan]] in [[New York City]]. Its southern end is at '''Trinity Place''', of which it is a continuation, and its northern end is at [[Canal Street (Manhattan)|Canal Street]]. Trinity Place begins at [[Battery Park|Battery Place]] and runs uptown, passing west of [[Trinity Church (New York City)|Trinity Church]], the Trinity and United States Realty Buildings and [[Zuccotti Park]]. It then forms the southern part of the eastern boundary of the [[World Trade Center site]] before becoming Church Street, which continues as the eastern boundary. A few blocks before Canal Street, Church Street connects to the southern end of [[Avenue of the Americas]] (Sixth Avenue), with a roadway branching off Church Street. When not obstructed by construction on the [[World Trade Center site]], Trinity Place, Church Street, and Avenue of the Americas form a continuous northbound four-lane through-route from Lower Manhattan to [[Central Park]]. Church Street is named after Trinity Church, a historic [[Gothic architecture|Gothic-style]] parish church on [[Broadway (Manhattan)|Broadway]] at [[Wall Street]], Extended in 1784, Church Street was in existence as early as 1761. Part of the street was owned by the church, but was given to the city in 1804.{{cite streetbook}}, p.39 Trinity Place is also a namesake of the church, being named so in 1834, prior to which it was known at various times as "Lumber Street" and "Lombard Street".{{cite streetbook}}, p. 101 Prior to 1869, the south end of the street was at Fulton Street, three blocks north of Trinity Place;[[:c:File:1865 Dripps Map of New York City - Geographicus - NewYork-dripps-1865.jpg|1865 map]] then, over several years, a connection was cut through those blocks, both streets were widened, and Trinity Place was extended south to Morris Street. The work, plagued by delays and, allegedly, corruption, was completed by the end of 1872.[[:c:File:1873 Dripps Pocket Map of New York City, Brooklyn and Hoboken - Geographicus - NYC-dripps-1873.jpg|1873 map]]; [https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1869/05/06/79818624.pdf "The Church Street Extension",] ''The New York Times'' (May 6, 1869); [https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1870/08/13/79824310.pdf "Church Street Extension",] ''The New York Times'' (August 13, 1870); [https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1871/08/19/90533552.pdf "Cholera Seeds",] ''The New York Times'' (August 19, 1871); [https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1872/12/15/79204090.pdf "New York and Suburban News. New York",] ''The New York Times'' (December 15, 1872), paragraph 5 ==Places== The Church Street Station post office at [[90 Church Street]] serves the [[10048 (ZIP code)|10048 ZIP code]] as well as the surrounding area, and is listed on the [[National Register of Historic Places listings in Manhattan below 14th Street|National Register of Historic Places]], as is the Canal Street Station post office at the north end of Church Street. Other notable buildings include the rear of the 1765 [[St. Paul's Chapel]], the residential tower under construction at [[99 Church Street]], and [[St. Peter's Roman Catholic Church, New York|St. Peter's Church]]. Near Rector Street, Trinity Place passes under the Trinity Place bridge. Completed in 1989, the bridge is a private elevated walkway connecting the rear side of Trinity Church to its parish house across Trinity Place. The [[IND Eighth Avenue Line]] ({{NYCS trains|Eighth south}}) in the [[New York City Subway]] runs below Church Street from Liberty Street to Sixth Avenue. A portion of the [[BMT Broadway Line]] ({{NYCS trains|Broadway south}}) runs under Church Street south of [[Vesey Street]]. The [[Cortlandt Street (BMT Broadway Line)|Cortlandt Street station]], damaged in the [[September 11 attacks]], is adjacent to the former site of the Twin Towers. ==Gallery==
File:Canal St PO jeh.JPG|Canal Street Station post office at north end of Church Street File:Cary Building.jpg|The [[Cary Building (New York City)|Cary Building]] is a [[New York City Landmark]] and listed on the [[National Register of Historic Places]] File:HABSStPaulsChapel crop.png|The rear of [[St. Paul's Chapel (New York, New York)|St. Paul's Chapel]] in 1937 File:St. Peter's Roman Catholic Church 22 Barclay Street.jpg|[[St. Peter's Roman Catholic Church, New York|St. Peter's Roman Catholic Church]] on the corner of Barclay Street, also a NYC landmark and on the NRHP
==References== '''Notes''' {{reflist}} {{more citations needed|date=May 2013}} ==External links== *{{commons category-inline | Church Street (Manhattan)}} {{Streets of Manhattan}} [[Category:Streets in Manhattan]] [[Category:Lower Manhattan]] [[Category:World Trade Center]]

revision.comment: /* Robertson family */
revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=December 2013}} {{Infobox television | show_name = Duck Dynasty | image = Duck Dynasty Promo.jpg | caption = The Robertsons, from left: Miss Kay, Phil, Willie, Si, Jase, and Korie | genre = [[Reality television]] | developer = [[A&E Networks]] | starring = {{unbulleted list|[[Willie Robertson]]|[[Phil Robertson]]|[[Jase Robertson]]|[[Si Robertson]]|[[Kay Robertson]]|[[Korie Robertson]]|Jep Robertson}} | narrated = Willie Robertson | theme_music_composer = [[ZZ Top]] | opentheme = "[[Sharp Dressed Man]]" (seasons 1–6) | country = United States | language = English | num_seasons = 11 | num_episodes = 130 | list_episodes = List of Duck Dynasty episodes | executive_producer = {{Plainlist| * Deirdre Gurney * Scott Gurney * Elaine Frontain Bryant * Lily Neumeyer }} | location = [[Monroe, Louisiana|Monroe]] and [[West Monroe, Louisiana]] | runtime = 22–30 minutes | company = Gurney Productions | distributor = [[A+E Networks]]
[[Lions Gate Entertainment|Lionsgate]] (DVD) | channel = [[A&E (TV channel)|A&E]] | picture_format = [[480i]] ([[Standard-definition television|SDTV]])
[[1080i]] ([[High-definition television|HDTV]]) | audio_format = | first_aired = {{Start date|2012|03|21}} | last_aired = {{End date|2017|03|29}} | preceded_by = | followed_by = | website = http://www.aetv.com/duck-dynasty | website_title = Duck Dynasty on A&E | production_website = http://www.gurneyproductions.com/content/duck-dynasty }} '''''Duck Dynasty''''' is an American [[reality television]] series on [[A&E (TV channel)|A&E]] that portrayed the lives of the Robertson family, who became successful from their family-operated business, [[Duck Commander]]. The [[West Monroe, Louisiana]] business makes products for [[Waterfowl hunting|duck hunters]], primarily a [[duck call]] called ''Duck Commander''. The Robertson men—brothers Phil and Si, and Phil's sons Jase, Willie, and Jep—are known for their long beards and their conservative Protestant Christian views.{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/redneck-millionaires-built-duck-dynasty-duck-call-business/story?id=15961955#.T4H3ytl5nXo|title='Redneck' Millionaires Built 'Duck Dynasty' in Duck Call Business, Land Reality Show|publisher=ABC News|date=March 20, 2012|accessdate=April 8, 2012}} The family was previously featured on the series ''Benelli Presents Duck Commander'' and its spin-off, ''Buck Commander'', on the [[Outdoor Channel]];{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/03/18/arts/mar-19-24.html|newspaper=New York Times|title=The Week Ahead March 19–24|date=March 18, 2012}} Outdoor Channel acquired rerun rights to ''Duck Dynasty'' in 2016.[http://outdoorchannel.com/duck-dynasty Duck Dynasty] at OutdoorChannel.com. Retrieved October 10, 2016. The show has broken several ratings records on A&E and cable television as a whole. The fourth-season premiere drew 11.8 million viewers; the most-watched nonfiction cable series in history.{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/449221/duck-dynasty-season-4-premiere-breaks-ratings-records|title=Duck Dynasty: Season 4 Premiere Breaks Ratings Records|publisher=E! Online|date=August 15, 2013|accessdate=May 1, 2014}} In mid-December 2013, controversy from an interview Phil Robertson gave to ''[[GQ]]'' magazine resulted in an indefinite suspension by A&E, due to remarks he made which were being widely viewed as anti-gay.[https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/12/28/television-duckdynasty-idUSL2N0K619E20131228 A&E calls Phil Robertson back to 'Duck Dynasty' after anti-gay flap], reuters.com; accessed August 17, 2015.[http://www.today.com/entertainment/duck-dynasty-star-phil-robertson-stands-his-anti-gay-comments-2D11792708 "'Duck Dynasty' star Phil Robertson stands by his anti-gay comments"], today.com; accessed August 17, 2015. Following public pressure on A&E to lift the suspension, he was reinstated nine days later.[https://nypost.com/2013/12/27/duck-dynasty-gets-phil-robertson-back ''Duck Dynasty'' gets Phil Robertson back], nypost.com; accessed August 17, 2015. The show earned $80 million in advertising sales for the first nine months of 2013, and merchandise has generated another $400 million in revenue.[https://www.forbes.com/sites/clareoconnor/2013/11/06/duck-dynastys-brand-bonanza-how-ae-and-walmart-turned-camo-into-400-million-merchandise-sales/ Duck Dynasty's Brand Bonanza: How A&E (And Walmart) Turned Camo Into $400 Million Merchandise Sales], Forbes.com; accessed August 17, 2015.{{cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2013-12-24/-duck-dynasty-dad-risks-500-million-with-gay-sin-remark.html|work=Bloomberg|title=‘Duck Dynasty' Dad Risks $500 Million With Gay-Sin Remark}}[http://www.cbsnews.com/news/duck-dynasty-backlash-shows-red-state-spending-muscle "Duck Dynasty" backlash shows red-state spending muscle], cbsnews.com; accessed August 17, 2015. The series ended on March 29, 2017, with the hour-long finale "End of an Era".[http://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/2016/11/17/duck-dynasty-to-end-after-11-seasons.html "Duck Dynasty" to end after 11 seasons], foxnews.com; accessed November 18, 2016 ==Members== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:5%;" |Name ! rowspan="2" style="width:3%;" |Family Member ! colspan="11" | Seasons |- !style="width:2%;" |1 !style="width:2%;" |2 !style="width:2%;" |3 !style="width:2%;" |4 !style="width:2%;" |5 !style="width:2%;" |6 !style="width:2%;" |7 !style="width:2%;" |8 !style="width:2%;" |9 !style="width:2%;" |10 !style="width:2%;" |11 |- |[[Willie Robertson]] |CEO |colspan="11" {{CMain|Main}} |- |[[Korie Robertson]] |Willie's wife |colspan="11" {{CMain|Main}} |- |[[Sadie Robertson]] |Willie's daughter |colspan="11" {{CMain|Main}} |- |John Luke Robertson |Willie's son |colspan="10" {{CMain|Main}} |- |Mary Kate McEacharn-Robertson |John Luke's wife |colspan="7" |Employee |colspan="11" {{CMain|Main}} |- |John Godwin |Employee |colspan="11" {{CMain|Main}} |} ==Robertson family== {{BLP sources section|date=June 2015}} '''Parents''' * Phil Alexander Robertson, born {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1946|4|24}} * Marsha Kay "Miss Kay" Robertson (née Carroway), born {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1947|12|21}} '''Children'''{{Cite news|url=https://mondaymondaynetwork.com/entertainment/duck-dynasty/phil-robertsons-tough-love-inspired-alan-robertson-become-preacher/|title=Alan Robertson Tells The Truth About His "Tough Childhood" With Phil...|date=2017-12-25|work=MondayMondayNetwork.com|access-date=2018-06-09|language=en-US}} {| class="wikitable" ! ! Name ! Date of birth ! Relationship |- ! 1 | style="background:#8ab8e6;" | Marshal Alan Robertson | {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1967|1|05}}{{citation needed|date=November 2015}} | Married to Lisa Gibson; the couple have two daughters |- ! 2 | style="background:#8ab8e6;" | Jason "Jase" Silas Robertson | {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1969|8|16}}{{citation needed|date=November 2015}} | Married to Melissa Louise "Missy" West; the couple have three children |- ! 3 | style="background:#8ab8e6;"| Willie Jess Robertson | {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1972|4|22}}{{citation needed|date=November 2015}} | Married to Korie Maree Howard; the couple have six children |- ! 4 | style="background:#8ab8e6;" | Jules Jeptha "Jep" Robertson | {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1978|5|28}}{{citation needed|date=November 2015}} | Married to Jessica Pamela Strickland; the couple have five children |} ===Phil Robertson=== {{main|Phil Robertson}} The family [[patriarch]] and creator of the ''[[Duck Commander]]'' duck call. He was a standout quarterback at [[Louisiana Tech Bulldogs football|Louisiana Tech]]{{cite web|url=http://www.cbssports.com/collegefootball/eye-on-college-football/23626584/louisiana-tech-honors-terry-bradshaw-phil-robertson-at-tulane-game|work=CBS Sports|last=Patterson|first=Chris|title=Louisiana Tech honored Terry Bradshaw, Phil Robertson Thursday|date=September 13, 2013|accessdate=September 15, 2013}} (actually starting ahead of future Hall of Famer [[Terry Bradshaw]]) and was contacted by the [[Washington Redskins]] after his junior year. He chose instead to quit football because it interfered with duck hunting season.{{cite web|url=http://www.inquisitr.com/416910/phil-robertson-explains-why-he-turned-down-nfl-for-duck-dynasty|title=Phil Robertson Explains Why He Turned Down NFL For 'Duck Dynasty'|publisher=Inquisitr.com|date=November 29, 2012|accessdate=December 15, 2012}} Phil graduated from Louisiana Tech with a Bachelor of Arts degree in Physical Education and later received a Masters of Arts degree in Education via night classes while working as a schoolteacher.{{cite web|author=hollyandersonsi|url=http://college-football.si.com/2012/03/22/duck-punt-how-phil-robertson-found-stardom-after-giving-up-football|title=Duck Punt: How Phil Robertson found stardom after giving up football|publisher=College-football.si.com|date=March 22, 2012|accessdate=December 25, 2013}} Phil went through a "dark period" while running a bar that led to his separation from his wife. It was at this low point he reports that he found Christ and reconciled with his wife. It was then that he invented his duck call, and founded the Duck Commander Company in 1973.{{cite web|author=Phil Robertson|url=http://www.duckcommander.com/duckmen/profile/3/phil_robertson.aspx|title=Profile: Phil Robertson|publisher=Duck Commander|accessdate=June 16, 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.aetv.com/duck-dynasty/meet-family/phil-robertson |title=Phil Robertson – Duck Dynasty Cast |publisher=AEtv.com |accessdate=June 16, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120619135710/http://www.aetv.com/duck-dynasty/meet-family/phil-robertson/ |archivedate=June 19, 2012 |df=mdy-all }} Phil is known for his dislike of modern technology, calling himself "a low-tech man in a high-tech world," and his concern that his grandchildren are becoming "[[yuppie]]s". At the end of each episode, the family is shown at the dining table, usually with Phil praying over the meal.{{cite web|last=Becker|first=Kyle|title=Duck Dynasty Star: 'They Told Us To Stop Praying To Jesus|url=http://www.ijreview.com/2013/10/85738-duck-dynasty-star-told-us-stop-praying-jesus-wouldnt-offend-muslims|date=October 2013|accessdate=August 17, 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140215221425/http://www.ijreview.com/2013/10/85738-duck-dynasty-star-told-us-stop-praying-jesus-wouldnt-offend-muslims/|archivedate=February 15, 2014|df=mdy-all}} ===Marsha Kay "Miss Kay" Robertson=== [[Kay Robertson]] (née Carroway) married Phil on January 11, 1966.{{cite web|url=http://starcasm.net/archives/199757|title=Korie Willie Robertson Marry|publisher=Starcasm.net|accessdate=May 4, 2013}} She is usually addressed as "Miss Kay" by her husband and sons. Kay married Phil at age 16. She is the mother of Alan, Jase, Willie, and Jep. She loves cooking and often has her entire family over for a home-cooked meal after a hard day's work.{{cite web|url=http://www.aetv.com/duck-dynasty/meet-family/miss-kay-robertson|title=Miss Kay Robertson profile|publisher=AEtv.com|accessdate=June 16, 2012}} ===Willie Robertson=== {{main|Willie Robertson}} Phil and Miss Kay's third son, and [[CEO]] of [[Duck Commander]]. Willie has a [[bachelor's degree]] in Health and Human Performance from [[University of Louisiana at Monroe|NE Louisiana University]], with an emphasis on Business.{{cite web|url=http://www.louisiana-destinations.com/duck-dynasty.htm|title=Duck Dynasty on A&E about the Duck Commander family of Phil Robertson, filmed near West Monroe Louisiana: videos, cast of characters, maps, episodes, links|publisher=Louisiana-destinations.com|accessdate=December 25, 2013}} He took Duck Commander from a family business to a multimillion-dollar empire.{{cite web|url=http://www.aetv.com/duck-dynasty/meet-family/willie-robertson |title=Willie Robertson – Duck Dynasty Cast |publisher=AEtv.com |accessdate=June 16, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120617192227/http://www.aetv.com/duck-dynasty/meet-family/willie-robertson/ |archivedate=June 17, 2012 |df=mdy-all }} He and his wife Korie have six children.Collier, Myles (October 17, 2013). [http://www.christianpost.com/news/duck-dynasty-willie-and-korie-robertson-adopting-new-child-speak-of-benefits-of-adoption-106870 "''Duck Dynasty''{{'}}s Willie and Korie Robertson Adopting New Child, Speak of Benefits of Adoption]". christianpost.com; retrieved January 8, 2014.White, Chelsea (October 30, 2013). [http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2479270/Duck-Dynastys-Willie-Robertson-opens-family-says-consider-adopting-again.html "'I will never say never!': ''Duck Dynasty''{{'}}s Willie Robertson says he would consider adopting again"], dailymail.com; retrieved January 8, 2013. ====John Luke Robertson==== Son of Willie and Korie, and the second-oldest child of the family after Rebecca. He attended [[Ouachita Christian High School]] and is currently enrolled at [[Liberty University]]. ====Mary Kate Robertson==== Mary Kate is John Luke's wife. Mary Kate and John Luke were married on June 28, 2015. She also attends Liberty University and studies Women's Leadership.http://www.thelittleduckwife.com/p/faq.html ====Rebecca Robertson==== The foster daughter of Willie and Korie, and the eldest of their six children. The family originally were Rebecca's host when she was an [[exchange student]] from [[Taiwan]] and have since adopted her as their own.{{cite web|url=http://starcasm.net/archives/190635|title=Korie Willie Robertson's 5 Kids|publisher=Starcasm.net|accessdate=May 4, 2013}}{{cite web|url=http://www.aetv.com/duck-dynasty/meet-family/korie-robertson |title=Korie Robertson |publisher=AETV.com |accessdate=June 16, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120614012930/http://www.aetv.com/duck-dynasty/meet-family/korie-robertson/ |archivedate=June 14, 2012 |df=mdy-all }} After completing a two-year fashion internship in [[Southern California]], she returned home to West Monroe and opened a clothing boutique. She married her fiancée, John Reed Loflin, in Mexico on December 3, 2016.{{cite web|url=http://m.eonline.com/news/813447/duck-dynasty-s-willie-robertson-walks-daughter-rebbeca-lo-robertson-down-the-aisle|title=Duck Dynasty's Willie Robertson Walks Daughter Down the Aisle}} ====Sadie Robertson==== {{main|Sadie Robertson}} The daughter of Willie and Korie, who attended [[Ouachita Christian High School]].{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/sadierob|title=Sadie Robertson Twitter Profile|accessdate=December 29, 2013}} Her graduation is shown in Season 10. Sadie now is an influential speaker and author.{{Cite news|url=https://mondaymondaynetwork.com/entertainment/duck-dynasty/whats-next-for-duck-dynasty-star-sadie-robertson/|title=What’s Next For Duck Dynasty Star, Sadie Robertson?|date=2017-07-28|work=MondayMondayNetwork.com|access-date=2018-06-09|language=en-US}} ====Willie Robertson Jr.==== Adopted son of Willie and Korie. ====Bella Robertson==== Youngest daughter of Willie and Korie. ====Rowdy Robertson==== Adopted son of Willie and Korie. His adoption is shown being finalized in Season 11.{{citation needed|date=March 2017}} ===Jason "Jase" Robertson=== {{main|Jase Robertson}} Phil and Miss Kay's second son. Jase is in charge of the manufacturing aspects at Duck Commander.{{cite web|first=Jase|last=Robertson|url=http://www.duckcommander.com/duckmen/profile/7/jase_robertson.aspx|title=Profile: Jase Robertson|publisher=Duck Commander|accessdate=June 16, 2012}} Along with other employees, Jase tunes the duck calls by hand. ====Reed Robertson==== The eldest child and first son of Jase and Missy, who attended [[Ouachita Christian High School]], playing football and baseball.McMillon, Lynn. [http://www.christianchronicle.org/article/a-conversation-with-missy-robertson "A conversation with Missy Robertson"] in ''[[The Christian Chronicle]]'' (May 2013). Retrieved November 18, 2013. His graduation is shown in Season 6. He is currently attending [[Harding University]], and is married to Brighton Thompson; their wedding is shown in Season 11. He started a music career in [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]]. ====Cole Robertson==== The second son of Jase and Missy, who attended [[Ouachita Christian High School]], and played baseball. His graduation is shown in Season 10. ====Mia Robertson==== The youngest child and only daughter of Jase and Missy. She was born with a [[cleft lip and palate]] and, as of the end of Season 9, has had six surgeries to correct it. ===Jules Jeptha "Jep" Robertson=== Phil and Miss Kay's youngest son, who films and edits DVDs of the Robertson family's duck hunts. He is often seen at Duck Commander and at family dinners. Jep and Jessica have five children. They introduced the newest addition to their family, an adopted son they named Jules Augustus (nicknamed "Gus"), on the premiere of their spin-off series ''[[Jep and Jessica: Growing the Dynasty]]''{{cite web|last1=Bacardi|first1=Francesca|title=Duck Dynasty Stars Introduce Adopted Baby Boy|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/732908/duck-dynasty-stars-jep-robertson-and-jessica-robertson-introduce-their-adopted-baby-boy-jules|website=E! Online|accessdate=January 22, 2016|language=en-US}} on January 20, 2016, which had an audience of more than two million. The second season premiered on February 22, 2017. '''Children''' {| class="wikitable" ! ! Name ! Date of birth |- ! 1 | style="background:pink;" | Lillian Mae "Lily" Robertson | {{birth date and age|mf=yes|2002|12|26}}{{citation needed|date=November 2015}} |- ! 2 | style="background:pink;" | Merritt Decatur Robertson | {{birth date and age|mf=yes|2004|7|30}}{{citation needed|date=November 2015}} |- ! 3 | style="background:pink;" | Priscilla June Robertson | {{birth date and age|mf=yes|2006|8|4}}{{citation needed|date=November 2015}} |- ! 4 | style="background:#8ab8e6;" | River Alexander Robertson | {{birth date and age|mf=yes|2008|12|5}}{{citation needed|date=November 2015}} |- ! 5 | style="background:#8ab8e6;" | Jules Augustus "Gus" Robertson | {{birth date and age|mf=yes|2015 |11|6}}{{citation needed|date=November 2015}} |} ===Marshal "Alan" Robertson=== Phil and Kay's eldest son, who left the family business to become a preacher, but rejoined the family both doing public relations at Duck Commander and appearing on the show since Season 4. He wanted to join the show to spread the Word of God to more people. Alan married Lisa Robertson, (''née'' Gibson) on November 9, 1984,''A New Season'', by Al & Lisa Robertson with Beth Clark. Nashville, TN: [[Howard Books]], 2014, p. 110; retrieved April 13, 2015. and is the only adult male in the family without a beard.{{cite web|last=Takeda|first=Allison|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/duck-dynasty-to-feature-beardless-brother-alan-robertson-in-season-4-2013286|title=Beardless Duck Dynasty Brother Alan Robertson Joins Season 4 Cast|work=Us Weekly|date=June 28, 2013|accessdate=October 31, 2013}} '''Children''' {| class="wikitable" ! ! Name ! Date of birth ! Notes |- ! 1 | style="background:pink;" | Elizabeth Anna Robertson |{{birth date and age|mf=yes|1986|2|28}}''A New Season'', by Al & Lisa Robertson with Beth Clark. Nashville, TN: [[Howard Books]], 2014, p. 126; retrieved April 13, 2015. |Married to [http://duckcommander.com/meet-the-family/jay-stone Jay Stone]; the couple have three daughters |- ! 2 | style="background:pink;" | Katie Alexis Robertson |{{birth date and age|mf=yes|1987|11|30}}''A New Season'', by Al & Lisa Robertson with Beth Clark. Nashville, TN: [[Howard Books]], 2014, p. 145; retrieved April 13, 2015. |Married to Vinny Mancuso; the couple have one son |} ===Silas "Si" Robertson=== {{main|Si Robertson}} Phil's brother (born August 18, 1948);[http://www.intelius.com/results.php?ReportType=1&formname=name&qf=Christine&qmi=&qn=Robertson&qcs=Ouachita+Parish%2C+Louisiana&focusfirst=1 Christine Raney Robertson age], intelius.com; accessed August 25, 2015. a [[Vietnam War]] veteran, and uncle to Phil and Miss Kay's four sons.{{cite web|url=http://www.aetv.com/duck-dynasty/meet-family/si-robertson|title=Si Robertson profile|publisher=AEtv.com|accessdate=June 16, 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120617192844/http://www.aetv.com/duck-dynasty/meet-family/si-robertson/|archivedate=June 17, 2012|df=mdy-all}} Si works at Duck Commander; making the reeds that go into every duck call.{{cite web|author=Si Robertson|url=http://www.duckcommander.com/duckmen/profile/4/si_robertson.aspx|title=Profile: Si Robertson|publisher=Duck Commander|accessdate=June 16, 2012}} Si is known for his storytelling, and his constant use of the expressions "Hey!" and "Jack" (which ends many of his sentences), and for his ever-present green [[Tupperware]] cup, (which his mother sent him while he was stationed in Vietnam); ever-filled with iced tea. Si retired from the Army in 1993 with the rank of Sergeant First Class (E-7). Robertson is recognized for his military career with an exhibit at the Chennault Aviation and Military Museum in [[Monroe, Louisiana]]. Si has been married to Christine for 48 years — she, with the exception of the series finale, has declined to appear on the show.{{cite web|url=http://www.aetv.com/duck-dynasty/pictures/the-robertson-couples-in-love-17223216/5-si-christine-dating-pic-17223226#5-si-christine-dating-pic|title=The Robertson Couples in Love|publisher=Duck Commander|accessdate=July 4, 2013}} He and his wife Christine have two children, Trasa and Scott.{{citation needed|date=August 2016}} Scott has not appeared on the show, although Trasa made a brief appearance in the episode "Stand by Mia".{{cite web|url= http://decoy.tvpassport.com/news/just-ducky-robertsons-entertain-millions-duck-dynasty?subid=national-00001|title=Just ducky: Robertsons entertain millions in 'Duck Dynasty'|last=Brewer|first=Kyla|publisher=TV Media|accessdate=August 11, 2016}} Si also appears in the show's second spin-off ''[[Going Si-Ral]]'' alongside [[Willie Robertson]], in which Si studies the Internet.{{cite news|url=http://www.nola.com/tv/index.ssf/2016/11/duck_dynasty_going_si-ral_spinoff.html|title='Duck Dynasty' spinoff 'Going Si-Ral' gets an airdate|last=Scott|first=Mike|work=[[Times-Picayune]]|date=November 3, 2016}} '''Children''' {| class="wikitable" ! ! Name ! Date of birth ! Notes |- ! 1 | style="background:pink;" | Trasa Lee Robertson | {{birth date and age|1975|8|30}}{{citation needed|date=November 2015}} | Married to Kyle Cobern; the couple have four sons |- ! 2 | style="background:#8ab8e6;" | Scott Merritt Robertson | {{birth date and age|1977|12|18}}{{citation needed|date=November 2015}} | Married to Marsha Markert; the couple have four sons |} ==Others who have recurring appearances== * John Godwin – An employee at Duck Commander since 2002, mainly building duck calls, managing supplies, and overseeing the shipping department as well as being the decoy technician.{{Cite news|url=https://mondaymondaynetwork.com/entertainment/duck-dynasty/duck-dynastys-godwin-shares-story/|title=Duck Dynasty's Godwin Shares His Story|date=2018-02-01|work=MondayMondayNetwork.com|access-date=2018-06-09|language=en-US}} * Justin Martin – An employee of Duck Commander, who is often given grief over his large figure.{{cite web|author=John Godwin|url=http://www.duckcommander.com/duckmen/profile/6/john_godwin.aspx|title=Profile: John Godwin|publisher=Duck Commander|accessdate=June 16, 2012}} * Mountain Man (Tim Guraedy) – A neighbor who operates his own air-conditioning repair business, and co-hosts a local radio talk show on [[KXKZ]].[http://www.z1075fm.com/zfamily.php "Z-Family"] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130217030241/http://www.z1075fm.com/zfamily.php |date=February 17, 2013 }}. Z107.5 Big Z Country; retrieved January 11, 2013. * Jimmy Red (Jimmy Gibson) – An old friend of Phil, Miss Kay, and Si; referred to as "Red" by Phil (five episodes; Seasons 1 and 2)Bayliss, Jeremy. [https://www.facebook.com/duckdynasty/posts/679565528726667 "This is Jimmy Gibson who works with Duck Commander and has appeared on Duck Dynasty!"] on ''Facebook'' (June 30, 2013); retrieved November 18, 2013. ==List of episodes== {{Main|List of Duck Dynasty episodes}} ==Ratings== An hour-long [[Christmas special]] premiered on December 5, 2012 as the Season 2 finale and became (at the time) the most-watched [[A&E (TV channel)|A&E]] episode in the network's history.{{cite web|last=Jensen|first=Jeff|url=http://insidetv.ew.com/2012/12/07/duck-dynasty-finale-ratings|title='Duck Dynasty' finale shatters records, tops broadcast|work=InsideTV|publisher=EW|date=December 7, 2012|accessdate=December 15, 2012}} The February 27, 2013, the Season 3 premiere tallied 8.9 million viewers, including five million in the adults 25–54 demographic and five million in adults 18–49 demographic, making the premiere (at the time) the most watched series in network history, beating the Season 2 finale.{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2013/02/28/duck-dynasty-becomes-aes-1-telecast-ever-and-the-1-nonfiction-series-on-cable-this-year/171356|title='Duck Dynasty' Becomes A&E's No. 1 Telecast Ever and the No. 1 Nonfiction Series on Cable This Year|work=TV by the Numbers|publisher=Zap2it.com|date=February 28, 2013|accessdate=May 4, 2013}} The one-hour Season 3 finale (shown on April 24, 2013) tallied 9.6 million viewers, with 5.6 million in the Adults 25–54 demographic and 5.5 million in the Adults 18–49 demographic, making it the highest rated telecast in A&E history.{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2013/04/25/9-6-million-viewers-watch-aes-duck-dynasty-season-finale/179620|title=9.6 Million Viewers Watch A&E's 'Duck Dynasty' Season Finale|publisher=Zap2it.com|work=TVbytheNumbers|date=April 25, 2013|accessdate=April 25, 2013}} On August 14, 2013, the Season 4 premiere drew a total of 11.8 million viewers, an increase of 37% vs. the season three premiere, drawing 6.3 million viewers in the Adults 25–54 demographic, making it the most watched nonfiction series telecast in cable television history.{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2013/08/15/duck-dynasty-season-4-premire-garners-11-8-million-viewers-becoming-the-number-1-nofiction-telecast-in-cable-history/197848|title='Duck Dynasty' Season 4 Premiere Garners 11.8 Million Viewers, Sets Records|type=ratings|publisher=Zap 2 it|work=TV by the Numbers|date=August 15, 2013|accessdate=October 31, 2013}} According to ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'', the fourth season averaged 9.4 million viewers.{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/duck-dynasty-american-idol-will-668912|work=The Hollywood Reporter|first=Michael|last=O'Connell|title=Reality Showdown: Will 'Duck Dynasty' Spoil 'American Idol's' Reboot?}} Ratings declined after [[#GQ interview|Phil Robertson's controversial ''GQ'' interview]]. ''Duck Dynasty'' topped the list of celebrity/pop culture-themed costume searches on [[Yahoo!]] in October 2013, according to data compiled by Yahoo Web trend expert Carolyn Clark.{{cite news|title='Duck Dynasty', Walter White Among Most-Searched Halloween Costume Ideas on Yahoo|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/halloween-costumes-duck-dynasty-walter-651331|work=Hollywood reporter|first=Kimberly|last=Nordyke|date=October 28, 2013}} As of October 17, 2014, the show has averaged 8.3 million viewers for 2014.{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2014/10/17/duck-dynasty-season-7-to-premiere-november-19-on-ae/316444/|title='Duck Dynasty' Season 7 to Premiere November 19 on A&E|last=Bibel|first=Sara|date=October 17, 2014|accessdate=October 18, 2014}} According to an October 2014 release from ''[[E! Online]]'', the majority of the series's Facebook audience is Republican.{{cite web|url=http://ca.eonline.com/news/592974/the-walking-dead-and-the-voice-can-unite-the-nation|title=Can The Walking Dead and The Voice Unite the Nation?|last=Harnick|first=Chris|date=October 29, 2014|accessdate=October 29, 2014}} In 2016, ''[[The New York Times]]'' reported that ''Duck Dynasty'' "is the prototypical example of a show that is most popular in rural areas. The correlation between fandom and the percentage of people who [[United States presidential election, 2016|voted for President Trump]] was higher ... than it was for any other" of the 50 shows with the most [[Facebook Like]]s. It was most popular in rural Texas, Arkansas, and Louisiana, and least popular in the Northeast US.{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2016/12/26/upshot/duck-dynasty-vs-modern-family-television-maps.html |title='Duck Dynasty' vs. 'Modern Family': 50 Maps of the U.S. Cultural Divide |last=Katz |first=Josh |date=2016-12-27 |newspaper=The New York Times}} ===Seasonal ratings=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan=2 | Season ! rowspan=2 | Time slot ([[Eastern Time Zone (North America)|ET]]) ! rowspan=2 | # Ep. ! colspan=3 | Premiere ! colspan=3 | Finale ! rowspan=2 | Season

font-size:smaller;"| March 29, 2017 | 1.51{{cite web|url=http://www.showbuzzdaily.com/articles/showbuzzdailys-top-150-wednesday-cable-originals-network-finals-3-29-2017.html|title=Updated: ShowBuzzDaily's Top 150 Wednesday Cable Originals & Network Finals: 8.24.2016|last=Metcalf |first=Mitch|accessdate=November 30, 2017|work=ShowBuzzDaily|date= March 29, 2017}} | 0.50 | | 2017 |} ==Criticism== ===Editing controversy=== In 2012, [[Phil Robertson]] stated on ''Sports Spectrum'', a Christian sports publication, that he confronted producers about editors of the show telling them not to say Jesus' name while praying at the end of episodes, and that they added intermittent [[bleep censor]]s over random portions of the cast's unscripted dialogue although there was no profanity being spoken.{{cite web|url=http://www.thewrap.com/duck-dynasty-star-dishes-on-confronting-producers-over-fake-bleeps-cutting-jesus-video|title='Duck Dynasty' Star Reveals Clash With Producers Over Fake Bleeps, Cutting Jesus|type=video|newspaper=The Wrap}}{{cite web|work=TV news|url=https://tv.yahoo.com/news/duck-dynasty-star-reveals-clash-producers-over-fake-224906242.html|title='Duck Dynasty' Star Reveals Clash With Producers Over Fake Bleeps, Cutting Jesus|type=video|publisher=Yahoo!}} Robertson cited the issues as part of what is often called "[[spiritual warfare]]", that there was no [[swear word|swearing]] that needed to be edited out, and the prayers were being censored to avoid offending non-Christian religious people. A&E did not comment on the claims.{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/467620/duck-dynasty-controversy-phil-robertson-believes-network-edited-the-family-unfairly|title=Duck Dynasty Controversy: Phil Robertson Believes Network Edited the Family Unfairly|publisher=E! Online|place=UK|accessdate=December 25, 2013}} ===''GQ'' interview=== On December 18, 2013, A&E announced that it was suspending [[Phil Robertson]] from the show indefinitely over remarks he made during an interview with [[Drew Magary]] (''[[GQ|GQ Magazine]]'') which had attracted outside criticism.{{Cite web|last=Hibberd|first=James|date=December 18, 2013|url=http://insidetv.ew.com/2013/12/18/duck-dynasty-robertson-phil/?hpt=hp_t2|title='Duck Dynasty' star suspended for anti-gay comments|newspaper=Inside TV|publisher=EW|accessdate=December 21, 2013}} During the interview for a featured article in ''GQ's'' January 2014 issue, titled {{Anchor|What the Duck?}}''What the Duck?'', Magary asked Robertson: "What, in your mind, is sinful?"{{Cite web|last=Merrigan|first=Tara Wanda|date=December 19, 2013|url=https://www.gq.com/blogs/the-feed/2013/12/readers-react-to-gqs-duck-dynasty-story-and-phil-robertsons-indefinite-suspension.html|title=Readers React to GQ's 'Duck Dynasty' Story and Phil Robertson's Indefinite Suspension|newspaper=GQ|accessdate=December 21, 2013}} Robertson replied: "Start with homosexual behavior and just morph out from there. Bestiality, sleeping around with this woman and that woman and that woman and those men."{{Cite web|last=Magary|first=Drew|date=January 2014|url=https://www.gq.com/entertainment/television/201401/duck-dynasty-phil-robertson|title=What the Duck?|newspaper=GQ|pages=1–3|accessdate=December 21, 2013}} [[File:Phil Robertson by Gage Skidmore.jpg|left|thumb|Robertson speaking at [[Conservative Political Action Conference|CPAC]] 2015 in Washington, D.C.]] A&E stated they were "extremely disappointed to have read Phil Robertson's comments in ''GQ'', which are based on his own personal beliefs and are not reflected in the series ''Duck Dynasty''". He said he is a "product of the '60s" but has since lived his life on Biblical principles. He added: "I would never treat anyone with disrespect just because they are different from me."{{cite news|work=Fox News|department=Entertainment|url=http://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/2013/12/18/phil-robertson-suspended-after-comments-about-homosexuality|date=December 18, 2013|title='Duck Dynasty' star Phil Robertson suspended by A&E|accessdate=October 26, 2015}} The Robertson family released a statement about A&E's decision, refusing to do the show without him and supporting Phil by saying that while some of his comments were "coarse," his beliefs are "grounded in the teachings of the Bible."{{cite web|url=http://duckcommander.com/news/robertson-family-official-statement|publisher=Duckcommander.com|title=The Robertson Family Official Statement}} In the first public interview since the ''GQ'' interview, Robertson stood by his words and said: {{quote|Jesus will take sins away. If you're a homosexual, He'll take it away. If you're an adulterer, if you're a liar, what's the difference?{{Cite web|date=December 2013|url=http://abcnews.go.com/blogs/entertainment/2013/12/phil-robertson-defends-anti-gay-comments-all-i-did-was-quote-from-the-scriptures|title=Phil Robertson Defends Anti-Gay Comments: ‘All I Did Was Quote From the Scriptures’|publisher=abcnews.go.com|work=ABC News}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/12/23/phil-robertson-defends-anti-gay_n_4493517.html?ir=Gay+Voices|title=Phil Robertson, 'Duck Dynasty Star', Defends Anti-Gay Remarks During Bible Study Group|newspaper=The Huffington Post|date=December 23, 2013|first=James|last=Nichols}}}} Robertson's remarks were reported in the media, with reactions split. Many [[social conservative]]s, including his corporate sponsors, some religious groups, and some [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] politicians including [[Sarah Palin]], [[Bobby Jindal]] and [[Mike Huckabee]], supported his right to such opinions.{{Cite web|last=St. Amand|first=Jason|date=December 19, 2013|url=http://www.edgeboston.com/news/national/News/153328/more_conservatives_show_support_for_’duck_dynasty’_star|title=More Conservatives Show Support for 'Duck Dynasty' Star|newspaper=Edge Boston|accessdate=December 21, 2013}} Robertson faced significant opposition from individuals viewing his comments as [[anti-LGBT rhetoric|anti-gay]] and [[bigot]]ed.{{cite news|first=Will|last=Payne|place=West Monroe, LA|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2528043/Duck-Dynasty-family-seen-today.html|title=Duck Dynasty star Phil Robertson says he is a lover not a hater|work=DailyMail.co.uk|date=March 21, 2012|accessdate=April 14, 2014}}{{cite news|last=Kevin|first=Patrick|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/tv/showtracker/la-et-st-duck-dynasty-fans-outraged-over-aes-phil-robertson-punishment-20131219,0,4223629.story#axzz2oODoNFX2|title='Duck Dynasty' fans outraged over A&E's Phil Robertson punishment|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=December 19, 2013|accessdate=December 25, 2013}} In response, [[Cracker Barrel]] removed some ''Duck Dynasty'' products.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/clareoconnor/2013/12/21/cracker-barrel-chain-pulls-duck-dynasty-items-amid-phil-robertson-gay-slur-scandal|title=Cracker Barrel Chain Pulls Duck Dynasty Items Amid Phil Robertson Gay Slur Scandal|work=Forbes.com|date=December 21, 2013|accessdate=December 22, 2013|last=O'Connor|first=Clare}} The products were replaced after one day after a public outcry.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/clareoconnor/2013/12/22/cracker-barrel-oops-were-putting-duck-dynasty-products-back-on-our-shelves|title=Cracker Barrel: Oops! We're Putting Duck Dynasty Products Back On Our Shelves!|work=Forbes|first=Clare|last=O'Connor|date=December 22, 2013}} [[United Press International]] reported that A&E CEO Nancy Dubuc had received death threats for the decision to suspend Robertson indefinitely.{{Cite web|url=http://www.upi.com/Entertainment_News/TV/2013/12/21/Report-Phil-Robertson-to-appear-in-Duck-Dynasty-in-January/UPI-17251387647442|title=Report: Phil Robertson to appear in 'Duck Dynasty' in January|publisher=UPI|newspaper=Entertainment news|date=December 21, 2013}} On December 27, A&E reversed Robertson's suspension. The network cited Robertson's and the family's regret for the use of "coarse language" in discussing body parts,{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-duckdynasty-idUSBRE9BQ0J820131227|title=A&E puts Phil Robertson back on 'Duck Dynasty' after anti-gay flap|date=December 27, 2016|publisher=|via=Reuters}} and stated that A&E would launch a [[public service announcement]] across the channel's "entire portfolio" that would promote "tolerance and acceptance among all people."{{cite news|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/chi-duck-dynasty-reverses-phil-robertsons-suspension-20131227,0,4062820.story|work=Chicago Tribune|title=`Duck Dynasty': A&E reverses Phil Robertson's suspension|date=December 28, 2013}} A [[Human Rights Campaign]] representative saw the reinstatement as a positive step and said they had been assured that "the Robertson family is now open [...] to address the real harm that such anti-gay and racist comments can cause."[http://www.cnn.com/2013/12/27/showbiz/duck-dynasty-resumes "A&E: 'Duck Dynasty' resuming 'with the entire Robertson family'"], CNN.com; accessed August 14, 2015. CNN said the controversy showed that a [[culture war]] was at play, in part because of what GLAAD characterized as "offensive depictions of minorities" in public discourse. Republican [[Louisiana]] governor [[Bobby Jindal]] and others, mostly conservatives, noted the issue as a [[First Amendment]] right to [[free speech]],[http://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/chi-duck-dynasty-phil-robertson-20131220,0,1685719.story 'Duck Dynasty' star used anti-gay comments in 2010 speech], chicagotribune.com; accessed October 26, 2015.[http://www.thewire.com/politics/2013/12/what-anti-gay-comments-are-too-anti-gay-gop/356369 "What Anti-Gay Comments Are Too Anti-Gay for the GOP?"], thewire.com, December 2013; accessed August 17, 2015.[http://www.ibtimes.com/conservatives-defend-duck-dynasty-star-phil-robertsons-anti-gay-remarks-1516160 Conservatives Defend 'Duck Dynasty' Star Phil Robertson's Anti-Gay Remarks], ibtimes.com; accessed October 26, 2015. while liberals said that the First Amendment did not apply, since the question was not whether he had the right to speak his views, but rather whether sponsors and the network had the right to disassociate themselves from Phil and the program.[http://communities.washingtontimes.com/neighborhood/american-millennial/2013/dec/20/phil-robertson-and-americans-consitutinal-right-fr "Phil Robertson and an American's Constitutional right to free speech"], Washingtontimes.com; accessed August 14, 2015. ==Other television and media== The Robertsons appeared on ''[[Jimmy Kimmel Live!]]''. Scheduled musical guest [[Morrissey]] canceled because he objected to being on the show with those he called "animal serial killers". The band [[Churchill (band)|Churchill]] filled in for Morrissey. Phil Robertson responded, saying, "Whoever he is, I don't hold it against him." They made a parody video where they sold a carrot call, instead of a duck call, to call wild carrots to jump straight into their mouths.{{cite web|last=Woo|first=Kelly|url=https://tv.yahoo.com/news/-duck-dynasty--patriarch-s-secret-past-revealed--phil-robertson-turned-down-the-nfl--195603788.html?cache=clear|title='Duck Dynasty' patriarch's secret past revealed: Phil Robertson turned down the NFL!|publisher=Yahoo!|work=TV News|date= February 27, 2013|accessdate=April 2, 2013}} The Robertsons have appeared on ''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'', ''[[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno|Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]'', ''[[Late Night with Jimmy Fallon]]'', ''[[Live! with Kelly and Michael]]'', ''[[Today (U.S. TV program)|Today]]'', ''[[Katie (talk show)|Katie]]'', ''[[The Wendy Williams Show]]'', and ''[[The 700 Club|700 Club]]''. Willie Robertson appeared on [[Fox News Channel|FNC]]'s ''[[The Five (TV program)|The Five]]'' on August 13, 2013.{{cite news|title=Would Willie Robertson consider running for public office?|url=http://www.foxnews.com/on-air/the-five/index.html#http://video.foxnews.com/v/2603198063001/would-willie-robertson-consider-running-for-public-office/?playlist_id=1040983441001|work=Fox News|accessdate=August 16, 2013}} The Robertsons guest-starred on the season three premiere of ''[[Last Man Standing (U.S. TV series)|Last Man Standing]]''. Members of ''Duck Dynasty'' are featured in the music video of the #1 [[Country music|country]] song, "[[Wagon Wheel (song)|Wagon Wheel]]", by [[Darius Rucker]].{{cite web|first=Erica|last=Ritz|url=http://www.theblaze.com/stories/2013/03/23/did-you-catch-the-duck-dynasty-cast-in-darius-ruckers-new-wagon-wheel-music-video|title=Did You Catch the 'Duck Dynasty' Cast in Darius Rucker's New 'Wagon Wheel' Music Video?|type=video|work=The Blaze|date=March 23, 2013|accessdate=October 31, 2013}} Si Robertson lent his voice and personal appearance to the ''[[VeggieTales]]'' video, ''Merry Larry and the True Light of Christmas'', in which he narrates the video and appears as an okra mall janitor.{{cite web|url=http://www.christianpost.com/news/duck-dynastys-si-robertson-joins-owl-city-and-toby-mac-in-newest-veggietales-christmas-movie-104746|title=Duck Dynasty's Si Robertson Joins Owl City and Toby Mac in Newest VeggieTales Christmas Movie|work=[[Christian Post]]|date=September 17, 2013|accessdate=December 25, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv-movies/duck-dynasty-star-green-okra-new-veggie-tales-article-1.1453779|title=Duck Dynasty's' Si Robertson goes green – voicing an okra in new 'VeggieTales' Christmas DVD|work=New York Daily News|accessdate=December 25, 2013}} Sadie Robertson was a contestant on Season 19 of ''[[Dancing with the Stars]]''. Other members of her family appeared on one episode as well.[http://www.theblaze.com/stories/2014/10/07/sadie-robertson-defends-her-faith-family-and-phil-before-duck-dynasty-dance-and-si-willie-jep-and-jase-take-to-the-stage "ENTERTAINMENT Sadie Robertson Defends Her Faith, Family and Phil Before 'Duck Dynasty' Dance — and Here’s Why Si, Willie, Jep and Jase Also Took to the Ballroom Floor"], theblaze.com; accessed August 14, 2015. ===Christmas album=== The family released a Christmas album, ''[[Duck the Halls: A Robertson Family Christmas]]'', on the [[Universal Music Group Nashville|UMG Nashville]] label on October 29, 2013.{{cite web|url=http://newsok.com/duck-dynasty-holiday-album-duck-the-halls-a-robertson-family-christmas-released-today/article/3899102.html|title='Duck Dynasty' Holiday Album, 'Duck The Halls: A Robertson Family Christmas' Released Today|work=NewsOK.com|date=October 29, 2013|accessdate=November 5, 2013}} ====Charts==== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:19em;"| Details ! colspan="4"| Peak chart positions ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| Sales ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| [[List of music recording certifications|Certifications]] |- ! style="width:3em;font-size:85%;"| [[Billboard 200|US]]
{{cite web|url={{BillboardURLbyName|artist=the robertsons|chart=Billboard 200}}|title=The Robertsons|type=chart history|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]]|accessdate=November 7, 2013}} ! style="width:3em;font-size:85%;"|[[Top Country Albums|US Country]]
{{cite web|url={{BillboardURLbyName|artist=the robertsons|chart=Country Albums C}}|title=The Robertsons|type=chart history|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]]|accessdate=November 7, 2013}} ! style="width:3em;font-size:85%;"|[[Top Holiday Albums|US Holiday]]
{{cite web|url = {{BillboardURLbyName|artist=the robertsons| chart=Holiday Albums}}|title= The Robertsons|type=chart history|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]]|accessdate=November 7, 2013}} ! style="width:3em;font-size:85%;"|[[Canadian Albums Chart|Canada]]
{{cite web|url={{BillboardURLbyName|artist=the robertsons|chart=Canadian Albums}}|title=The Robertsons|type=chart history|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]]|accessdate=November 7, 2013}} |- ! scope="row"| ''[[Duck the Halls: A Robertson Family Christmas]]'' | * '''Released:''' October 29, 2013 * '''Label:''' [[Universal Music Group Nashville|UMG Nashville]] * '''Formats:''' CD, music download | 3 || 1 || 1 || 8 | * '''US:''' 755,700{{cite web|url=http://roughstock.com/news/2014/11/30887-country-album-chart-report-for-november-19-2014/|title=Country Album Chart Report For November 19, 2014 - RoughStock|first=Roughstock -|last=http://www.roughstock.com}}{{cite web|url=https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/11WvxJfSyClMBxoWjDq3Hr7beGfYtrarztuP-qjqW7ig/edit?pli=1&usp=embed_facebook|title=10 Country Albums - November 19, 2014}} | * '''[[Recording Industry Association of America|RIAA]]:''' Platinum{{Certification Cite Ref|region=United States|type=album|title=Duck the Halls|artist=The Robertsons}} * '''[[Music Canada|MC]]:''' Gold{{Certification Cite Ref|region=Canada|type=album|title=Duck the Halls: A Robertson Family Christmas|artist=The Robertson Family}} |} ====Singles==== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Year ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:14em;"| Single ! scope="col" colspan="2"| Peak chart
positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Album |- ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font-size:85%;"| [[Hot Country Songs|US Country]]
{{cite web|url={{BillboardURLbyName|artist=the robertsons|chart =Country Songs}}|title=The Robertsons|type=chart history|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]]|accessdate=December 27, 2013}} ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font-size:85%;"|[[Country Airplay|US Country Airplay]]

{{small|(Willie Robertson and [[Luke Bryan]])}} | 49 | 45 | align="left"| ''Duck the Halls: A Robertson Family Christmas'' |} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==Further reading== * [https://newrepublic.com/article/120394/latest-duck-dynasty-product-musical `Duck Dynasty`'s Success Is Entirely Based on Selling a Fantasy - The enduring, commercial fallacy of the "authentic" man], ''[[The New Republic]]'' ==External links== * {{official website|http://www.aetv.com/duck-dynasty/cast}} * {{IMDb title|id=2229907}} {{Duck Commander}} {{Critics' Choice Television Award for Best Reality Series}} {{A&ENetwork Shows}} [[Category:2010s American television series]] [[Category:2012 American television series debuts]] [[Category:2017 American television series endings]] [[Category:A&E (TV channel) shows]] [[Category:American reality television series]] [[Category:English-language television programs]] [[Category:Ouachita Parish, Louisiana]] [[Category:Robertson family]] [[Category:Television shows set in Louisiana]]

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2015}} {{Infobox person | image = | image_size = | name = Filaret Galchev
Φιλάρετος Καλτσίδης | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = 1963 | birth_place = [[Tbilisi]], [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | restingplace = | nationality = Russian and Greek | religion = | ethnicity = | residence = Russia | education = | alma mater = | occupation = Owner & chairman, [[Eurocement group]] | salary = |net_worth = {{aligned table|[[US$]]1 [[1,000,000,000|billion]]|(2018 ''[[The World's Billionaires|Forbes]]'' list){{cite web|title=Filaret Galchev|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/filaret-galchev/ |website=Forbes|accessdate=29 April 2018}}|US$1.3 billion|(2017 ''Forbes'' list)}} | spouse = | parents = | children = 2 | relatives = | website = }} '''Filaret Galchev''' ({{lang-ru|Филарет Гальчев}}; born 26 May 1963 in [[Tbilisi]], [[Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic]]){{cite web|title=Филарет Гальчев|url=http://www.vedomosti.ru/persons/9666/%D0%A4%D0%B8%D0%BB%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%B5%D1%82%20%D0%93%D0%B0%D0%BB%D1%8C%D1%87%D0%B5%D0%B2|publisher=[[Vedomosti]]|language=Russian|access-date=13 January 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141111233509/http://www.vedomosti.ru/persons/9666/%D0%A4%D0%B8%D0%BB%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%B5%D1%82%20%D0%93%D0%B0%D0%BB%D1%8C%D1%87%D0%B5%D0%B2#|archive-date=11 November 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} is a Russian businessman of [[Pontic Greek]] origin (Filaretos Kaltsidis), chairman of [[Eurocement group]]. ==Early life== Filaret Illitch Galchev was born in Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia, then a part of the Soviet Union. He graduated from [[Moscow Mining Institute]] ==Career== In 1996, Galchev and his partner, [[Georgy Krasnyansky]], created Rosuglesbyt which became a leading Russian coal enterprise. Then in 2000, Galchev partnered with [[Sergei Generalov]], then Russian Minister of Fuel and Energy, to privatize the Krasnoyarsk Coal Company. In 2002, Galchev sold his stake in the company to the MDM Group and immediately bought shares of Sterncement because he saw potential in the cement industry. By 2004, Galchev’s cement holdings produced 9.6 million tons of cement.{{cite web|title=Почему состояние Филарета Гальчева рухнуло с $5,6 млрд до $305 млн|url=https://www.vedomosti.ru/business/articles/2016/03/21/634331-filareta-galcheva|publisher=[[Vedomosti]]}} According to ''[[Forbes]]'', Galchev has a net worth of $1 billion, {{as of|2018|3}} ''[[The World's Billionaires]]''. ==Personal life== He is married with two children and lives in Moscow. == References == {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Galchev, Filaret}} [[Category:1963 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Tbilisi]] [[Category:Russian businesspeople]] [[Category:Greek businesspeople]] [[Category:Russian billionaires]] [[Category:Greek billionaires]] {{Russia-business-bio-stub}}
